column5: Got Avery to take Monday off so we could head up and see what effect we could have on the bush chicken population, and maybe bump inot a calf moose or deer at the same time.  We got up to camp before dark on Friday, and went in with an inch of snow on the ground.  Saturday was cloudy, but Sunday was likely the best day we've had all fall, we managed 9 birds over the course of the weekend and put a lot of mileage on the bike.  heres some pic's.                       Hoping to head up one last time next weekend with the wifey!!
Its a CLONE................. Nice shootin Pops and Son....
Good shooting,  They are my favourite upland bird  but are in serious decline in the south. Don't let the Walleye anglers tell you they are Ruffed Grouse.
Great report...that definitely looks like the good life
Congrats to both of you TJ Looks like you guys had a blast with them bush chickens Thanks for sharing Leechman
Great job on harvesting those Grouse. What were the Shotguns for?
We use a .410 for birds.. I had the rifles for anything biger.. lol
Nice shootin Tex, some nice birds there, and some great bonding  Joey
Good stuff boys. Nice to see father and son get some quality time together.    A got to ask though TJ, is Avery growing like a weed or are you standing in a hole?
Nope.. hes officially taller than me... and Im taller than my dad.. as a family we are growing up.. lol, its just takes us generations to do it...
LOl....Don't worry TJ, I've no doubt he'll always look up to you.
